data.title: ROT13 cipher
data.statement:
Jack Silver is an agent of the international spy agency. Due to limited time and resources on his current mission, he has chosen to use a simple cipher for communication: <<ROT13>>.

ROT13 is a substitution cipher in which each letter is replaced by the one 13 positions ahead in the alphabet, wrapping around to the beginning if needed. Since the alphabet contains 26 letters, <<ROT13 is its own inverse>>, meaning the same method can be used for both encoding and decoding.

Assist Jack Silver in encoding and decoding his messages to help him complete his mission.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Jack Silver is an agent of the international spy agency. Due to limited time and resources on his current mission, he has chosen to use a simple cipher for communication: ROT13.

ROT13 is a substitution cipher in which each letter is replaced by the one 13 positions ahead in the alphabet, wrapping around to the beginning if needed. Since the alphabet contains 26 letters, ROT13 is its own inverse, meaning the same method can be used for both encoding and decoding.

Assist Jack Silver in encoding and decoding his messages to help him complete his mission.
Input
A single line sentence text with an unknown amount of words (spaces) and no punctuations.

The characters only consist of uppercase letters of the alphabet from A to Z.
Output
The encoded /decoded sentence of text in uppercase
Constraints
1 <= length of text <= 1000
Example
Input
URYYB JBEYQ
Output
HELLO WORLD
